thread.title: GoPro unveils sub-$200 waterproof, WiFi Hero+ camera
thread.title_full: GoPro unveils sub-$200 waterproof, WiFi Hero+ camera

title: GoPro unveils sub-$200 waterproof, WiFi Hero+ camera
text:
GoPro's Hero+ waterproof Wi-Fi and Bluetooth-enabled camera. (Photo: Carter Dow Photography)
7 CONNECT 13 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE GoPro's newest camera packs Wi-Fi, waterproofing, 1080P video and 8 megapixel photos into a sub-$200 offering.
The new Hero+ camera ($199.99) hits authorized retailers and GoPro.com on Oct. 4. The Hero+ also has a built-in microphone, is wearable and mountable and Bluetooth-enabled so that you can connect to the GoPro mobile app (you can also use Wi-Fi).
“Even as we continue to raise the bar for our highest performing cameras like Hero 4 Black, Silver and Session, we remain committed to developing simplified products like Hero+ that make GoPro life-capture accessible to everyone,” said GoPro founder and CEO Nicholas Woodman in a statement accompanying the product announcement.
Other Hero+ features include 1080p60 and 720p60 video, time lapse and burst photos, built-in microphone, single button power-up and recording with QuikCapture, HiLight tagging of key moments, as well as SuperView wide-angle and Auto Low Light video modes.
In another nod to affordability, GoPro is also reducing the price of the smaller, lighter and waterproof Hero 4 Session mini-camera by $100 to $299.99.
USA TODAY
First Look: GoPro's new Hero 4 Session mini-camera
